intro: Dendromecon quercetorum, commonly known as the yellow tree-crown, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae and is characterized by its yellow, cup-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 feet. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and have a rough texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy addition to gardens in suitable climates.
